content: hey friends and crafters I have a really cool one for you I guess I always say
that but hey this is really cool today we're going to do like a hanging Lantern
and this is going to be really fun it can really give a cool effect in your
dungeons and your tile escapes you don't have to use the four tile escapes you
just for anything but it's a fun little craft pretty easy to do that you can use
to give some illumination to your dungeons you know I've been really
getting into the LED and that kind of thing and so this is a continuation of
that but before you're the table I want to say hello to Cora Briscoe she's a
very young fan of mine and she watches all my vids and I just want to say hi to
her keep crafting and keep dreaming Cora alright friends I'm gonna use a bamboo
fork for this craft alright and I'll cut the bottom off here those little round
pieces on the bottom there and then I'm gonna cut apart most of the fork off and
then where the fork meets the rest of the the body I'm going to cut that off
then I'm gonna trim a matchstick at a 45 degree angle I'm just gonna kind of
guess it and I'm gonna put this together with white glue I could do a hot glue
but I didn't want the glue all squirting all over the place so just be easier to
use the white glue leaves much less of a footprint when it dries right okay so
let that dry up that is set up and I'm gonna put a little bit more glue on here
on the joints and this will just help reinforce where I put this together so
just give it some extra strength there yeah I just use a toothpick and blend
that in don't to have the globs dry dries fairly flat now I'm going to use
these submersible wedding lights and these are smaller than tea lights I'm
gonna use the yellow light for the lantern itself so you can get these
anywhere online and to make the paint stick better to this thing and
everything else I'm gonna sand it up but I'm not sanding the light part just the
body itself so just around the light and the bottom part of the body okay so it's
sanded and ready to go now I'm gonna cover that light with a piece of tape
and when I black bomb this I don't want to paint the light part right so I'm
going to cover that up first okay so I'll just put that tape on there now
started assembling this I'm gonna use some goop and glue my our glue goop my
overhang here to the light I'm just doing the first layer because it twists
and turns on and I'm just doing the first layer I don't want to move to the
bottom layer because I don't want twist right now I needed some thin cardstock
and do a kind of a loop here and I'm gonna use a chain and a link and put the
card stock on the link there I wanted to give it a close-up to show what I did
and then I'm putting it on top of the the bracket I made and I'm just using
Rhinestone to make look make it look like a bolt is holding that on so now
black bombed it and it's coming along really nicely there there we go so here
it is with the light on so you can see that we the tape really protected the
light and we've got the whole light source there now I'm gonna paint this
thing and it's gonna be like it's on a pedestal of stone you could even do what
if you wanted so I'm just gonna do the sponge technique with the damp sponge
and the gray so I'll just make that look like a pedestal stone and carefully you
don't get it on the light if you do you can wipe it off then we use a small
sponge and highlight some gray on there so I like to do a little lighter gray
that gives it highlights not just one flat gray there we go nice looking good
okay now I'm gonna use my burnt umber and this will paint the arm there over
the light so it looks like the lantern is hanging that was kind of the idea of
this to me it look like the lantern is hanging so I'll paint that up and then
we'll let that dry now I'm gonna use a lighter brown you could really use
whatever you want and just kind of paint on it some lighter areas on that really
dark brown they're really coming to life here alright cool
now I'm going to use these jewelry caps and these beads to make a little cap
that will go on top of the lantern so here I've made it and I've black bombed
it and I'm gonna put actually glue it to the light so what I'm going to do is I'm
going to glue it to the top of the light with my goop and then I'll just break
off the links of the chain to the right length and then glue it in that holder
at the top of the lantern so here's a picture of what I did I also painted the
chain and the top of the lantern with a gunmetal because it was black and that
gave you my lantern so let's go to the table and look at these in play
so there we go guys I want to give you a couple ideas of what these look like in
the dark there so here we go here's our hanging Lantern and of course it's not
really hanging it's on that base but I think it really gives that kind of
effect the light is really great has that yet light just the little bits and
pieces we use not really expensive to make but a really spectacular effect I
think at the table so I'm really really happy with these and I hope you guys
have fun making them so there we go some great hanging lanterns for your tile
scapes or other projects hey crafter I hope you really enjoyed
the video if you did give your DM Scottie a thumbs up I'd really
appreciate it and you can find me on Facebook we got a great group on there
lots of uh projects also if you like the vid by not drop a dollar in the chip jar
you can just click on the video and tip directly to DM Scottie and if you want

it's a magazine I produced for my patreon friends and I want to say last
but not least go forth and craft yeah have fun crafting guys
